briefTitle: Study of LRG-002 Hard Capsules (Lek d.d., Slovenia) Used in the Prophylaxis of Antibiotic-associated Diarrhea in Adults.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With the Occurrence of Antibiotic-associated Diarrhea (AAD) - Per Protocol (PP) Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Diarrhea is defined as loose or watery stool (Type 5-7 according to Bristol Stool Form Scale (BSFS)), three times a day (frequent bowel movements with formed stool is not considered as diarrhea) in accordance with WHO criteria; based on the diary data (BSFS) and confirmation of AAD by the investigator. BSFS scale includes Types 1 to 7 where Types 1 and 2 indicate constipation, with 3 and 4 being the ideal stools as they are easy to defecate while not containing excess liquid, 5 indicate lack of dietary fiber, and 6 and 7 indicate diarrhea. AAD (antibiotic-associated diarrhea) is defined as diarrhea associated with the antibiotic use caused by C. difficile or of otherwise not identified etiology, upon analysis of stool samples and differential diagnostics according to investigator's judgment. Diarrhea was assessed in a diary.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With the Occurrence of Antibiotic-associated Diarrhea (AAD) - Intention to Treat (ITT) Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Diarrhea is defined as loose or watery stool (Type 5-7 according to Bristol Stool Form Scale (BSFS)), three times a day (frequent bowel movements with formed stool is not considered as diarrhea) in accordance with WHO criteria; based on the diary data (BSFS) and confirmation of AAD by the investigator. BSFS scale includes Types 1 to 7 where Types 1 and 2 indicate constipation, with 3 and 4 being the ideal stools as they are easy to defecate while not containing excess liquid, 5 indicate lack of dietary fiber, and 6 and 7 indicate diarrhea. AAD (antibiotic-associated diarrhea) is defined as diarrhea associated with the antibiotic use caused by C. difficile or of otherwise not identified etiology, upon analysis of stool samples and differential diagnostics according to investigator's judgment. Diarrhea was assessed in a diary.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Number of Bowel Movements Per Day
outcomeMeasures.description: Bowel movements were assessed based on the data of patient's diary

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With the Occurrence of Any Diarrhea
outcomeMeasures.description: Diarrhea is defined as loose or watery stool (Type 5-7 according to Bristol Stool Form Scale (BSFS)), three times a day (frequent bowel movements with formed stool is not considered as diarrhea) in accordance with WHO criteria; based on the diary data (BSFS) and confirmation of AAD by the investigator. BSFS scale includes Types 1 to 7 where Types 1 and 2 indicate constipation, with 3 and 4 being the ideal stools as they are easy to defecate while not containing excess liquid, 5 indicate lack of dietary fiber, and 6 and 7 indicate diarrhea. AAD (antibiotic-associated diarrhea) is defined as diarrhea associated with the antibiotic use caused by C. difficile or of otherwise not identified etiology, upon analysis of stool samples and differential diagnostics according to investigator's judgment. Diarrhea was assessed in a diary.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With the Occurrence of C. Difficile-associated Antibiotic-associated Diarrhea (AAD)
outcomeMeasures.description: Diarrhea is defined as loose or watery stool (Type 5-7 according to Bristol Stool Form Scale (BSFS)), three times a day (frequent bowel movements with formed stool is not considered as diarrhea) in accordance with WHO criteria; based on the diary data (BSFS) and confirmation of AAD by the investigator. BSFS scale includes Types 1 to 7 where Types 1 and 2 indicate constipation, with 3 and 4 being the ideal stools as they are easy to defecate while not containing excess liquid, 5 indicate lack of dietary fiber, and 6 and 7 indicate diarrhea. AAD (antibiotic-associated diarrhea) is defined as diarrhea associated with the antibiotic use caused by C. difficile or of otherwise not identified etiology, upon analysis of stool samples and differential diagnostics according to investigator's judgment. Diarrhea was assessed in a diary.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With the Occurrence of Non-C. Difficile-associated AAD
outcomeMeasures.description: Incidence of non-C. difficile-associated AAD assessed based on the data of stool analysis

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Duration of Antibiotic-associated Diarrhea (AAD)
outcomeMeasures.description: AAD is defined as diarrhea associated with the antibiotic use caused by C. difficile or of otherwise not identified etiology, upon analysis of stool samples and differential diagnostics according to investigator's judgment.The duration of AAD was the time from the onset of AAD to the normalization of stool form according to Bristol Stool Scale (types 1, 2, 3 and 4 where Types 1 and 2 indicate constipation, with 3 and 4 being the ideal stools as they are easy to defecate while not containing excess liquid) and the presence of normal stool within 48 hours was assessed based on the data of patient's diary.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Duration of Any Diarrhea
outcomeMeasures.description: Duration of any diarrhea is defined as the time from the onset of diarrhea to the normalization of stool shape according to the Bristol Stool Form Scale (BSFS) (Types 1, 2, 3, and 4) and the presence of normal stool for 48 hours). BSFS scale includes Types 1 to 7 where Types 1 and 2 indicate constipation, with 3 and 4 being the ideal stools as they are easy to defecate while not containing excess liquid, 5 indicate lack of dietary fiber, and 6 and 7 indicate diarrhea.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Stool Consistency
Number of Gastrointestinal Symptoms by Severity
outcomeMeasures.description: The severity of gastrointestinal symptoms, including nausea, vomiting, flatulence, abdominal pain and decreased appetite was assessed based on the data of patient's diary. Severity of symptoms was assessed based on the 5-point verbal scale \[0 to 4\] where 0- symptoms were absent, 4- symptoms were very severe

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Body Weight
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline in body weight assessed based on the clinical data

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Hospitalized
outcomeMeasures.description: Hospitalization rate was assessed based on the clinical data

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Using Standard Symptomatic Therapy
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of participants using standard symptomatic therapy (as "rescue medication") to relieve symptoms of acute diarrhea were assessed based on the clinical data

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Days of Using Standard Symptomatic Therapy
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of days of using standard symptomatic therapy (as "rescue medication") to relieve symptoms of acute diarrhea were assessed based on the clinical data
